H0.text: what did the akkadian empire include. Babylon

H1.text: what did the akkadian empire include. Sumer

H2.text: what did the akkadian empire include. Elam

H3.text: what did the akkadian empire include. Assyria

A4.text: the empire united the Semitic Akkadian and Sumerian speakers under one rule

A5.text: the Akkadian language was briefly imposed on neighbouring conquered states such as Elam, Lullubi, Hatti and Gutium

A6.text: The earliest known mention of Babylon as a small town appears on a clay tablet from the reign of Shar-Kali-Sharri (2217–2193 BC), of the Akkadian Empire.

A7.text: Kassite Babylon eventually became subject to the Middle Assyrian Empire (1365–1053 BC) to the north, and Elam to the east, with both powers vying for control of the city.

A8.text: claimed an empire extending from the Persian Gulf to the Mediterranean.

A9.text: The Akkadian Empire was the first state that successfully united larger parts of Mesopotamia in the 23rd century BC.
